rdi_ensemble.description: This field contains the sequential number of the ensemble to which the data in the output buffer apply.

rtc_year.description: This field contains the time in year from the WorkHorse ADCP’s real-time clock (RTC) that the current data ensemble began. The TS command (Set Real-Time Clock) initially sets the clock. The WorkHorse ADCP does account for leap years.

rtc_month.description: This field contains the time in month from the WorkHorse ADCP’s real-time clock (RTC) that the current data ensemble began. The TS command (Set Real-Time Clock) initially sets the clock. The WorkHorse ADCP does account for leap years.

rtc_day.description: This field contains the time in day from the WorkHorse ADCP’s real-time clock (RTC) that the current data ensemble began. The TS command (Set Real-Time Clock) initially sets the clock. The WorkHorse ADCP does account for leap years.

rtc_hour.description: This field contains the time in hour from the WorkHorse ADCP’s real-time clock (RTC) that the current data ensemble began. The TS command (Set Real-Time Clock) initially sets the clock. The WorkHorse ADCP does account for leap years.

rtc_minute.description: This field contains the time in minute from the WorkHorse ADCP’s real-time clock (RTC) that the current data ensemble began. The TS command (Set Real-Time Clock) initially sets the clock. The WorkHorse ADCP does account for leap years.

rtc_second.description: This field contains the time in second from the WorkHorse ADCP’s real-time clock (RTC) that the current data ensemble began. The TS command (Set Real-Time Clock) initially sets the clock. The WorkHorse ADCP does account for leap years.

rtc_hundredth.description: This field contains the time in hundredth from the WorkHorse ADCP’s real-time clock (RTC) that the current data ensemble began. The TS command (Set Real-Time Clock) initially sets the clock. The WorkHorse ADCP does account for leap years.

ensemble_msb.description: This field increments each time the Ensemble Number field (bytes 3,4) “rolls over.” This allows ensembles up to 16,777,215. See Ensemble Number field above.

bit_result.description: This field contains the results of the WorkHorse ADCP’s Built-in Test function. A zero code indicates a successful BIT result. The details can be found in Bit method.

speed_of_sound.description: Contains either manual or calculated speed of sound information (EC command).

depth_of_transducer.description: Contains the depth of the transducer below the water surface (ED command). This value may be a manual setting or a reading from a depth sensor.

heading.description: Contains the WorkHorse ADCP heading angle (EH command). This value may be a manual setting or a reading from a heading sensor.

pitch.description: Contains the WorkHorse ADCP pitch angle (EP command). This value may be a manual setting or a reading from a tilt sensor. Positive values mean that Beam #3 is spatially higher than Beam #4.

roll.description: Contains the WorkHorse ADCP roll angle (ER command). This value may be a manual setting or a reading from a tilt sensor. For up-facing WorkHorse ADCPs, positive values mean that Beam #2 is spatially higher than Beam #1. For down-facing WorkHorse ADCPs, positive values mean that Beam #1 is spatially higher than Beam #2.

salinity.description: Contains the salinity value of the water at the transducer head (ES command). This value may be a manual setting or a reading from a conductivity sensor.

temperature.description: Contains the temperature of the water at the transducer head (ET command). This value may be a manual setting or a reading from a temperature sensor.

mpt_minute.description: Contains the minute portion of the WorkHorse ADCP’s elapsed time measurement of the amount of time needed to complete the pinging of the current ensemble.

mpt_second.description: Contains the second portion of the WorkHorse ADCP’s elapsed time measurement of the amount of time needed to complete the pinging of the current ensemble.

mpt_hundredth.description: Contains the hundredth of a second portion of the WorkHorse ADCP’s elapsed time measurement of the amount of time needed to complete the pinging of the current ensemble.

head_std_dev.description: These fields contain the standard deviation (accuracy) of the heading and tilt angles from the gyrocompass/pendulums.

pitch_std_dev.description: These fields contain the standard deviation (accuracy) of the heading and tilt angles from the gyrocompass/pendulums.

roll_std_dev.description: These fields contain the standard deviation (accuracy) of the heading and tilt angles from the gyrocompass/pendulums.

adc_channel_0.description: These fields contain the outputs of the Analog-to-Digital Converter (ADC) located on the DSP board. The ADC sequentially samples one of the eight channels per ping group (the number of ping groups per ensemble is the maximum of the WP). These fields are zeroed at the beginning of the deployment and updated each ensemble at the rate of one channel per ping group.

adc_channel_1.description: These fields contain the outputs of the Analog-to-Digital Converter (ADC) located on the DSP board. The ADC sequentially samples one of the eight channels per ping group (the number of ping groups per ensemble is the maximum of the WP). These fields are zeroed at the beginning of the deployment and updated each ensemble at the rate of one channel per ping group.

adc_channel_2.description: These fields contain the outputs of the Analog-to-Digital Converter (ADC) located on the DSP board. The ADC sequentially samples one of the eight channels per ping group (the number of ping groups per ensemble is the maximum of the WP). These fields are zeroed at the beginning of the deployment and updated each ensemble at the rate of one channel per ping group.

adc_channel_3.description: These fields contain the outputs of the Analog-to-Digital Converter (ADC) located on the DSP board. The ADC sequentially samples one of the eight channels per ping group (the number of ping groups per ensemble is the maximum of the WP). These fields are zeroed at the beginning of the deployment and updated each ensemble at the rate of one channel per ping group.

adc_channel_4.description: These fields contain the outputs of the Analog-to-Digital Converter (ADC) located on the DSP board. The ADC sequentially samples one of the eight channels per ping group (the number of ping groups per ensemble is the maximum of the WP). These fields are zeroed at the beginning of the deployment and updated each ensemble at the rate of one channel per ping group.

adc_channel_5.description: These fields contain the outputs of the Analog-to-Digital Converter (ADC) located on the DSP board. The ADC sequentially samples one of the eight channels per ping group (the number of ping groups per ensemble is the maximum of the WP). These fields are zeroed at the beginning of the deployment and updated each ensemble at the rate of one channel per ping group.

adc_channel_6.description: These fields contain the outputs of the Analog-to-Digital Converter (ADC) located on the DSP board. The ADC sequentially samples one of the eight channels per ping group (the number of ping groups per ensemble is the maximum of the WP). These fields are zeroed at the beginning of the deployment and updated each ensemble at the rate of one channel per ping group.

adc_channel_7.description: These fields contain the outputs of the Analog-to-Digital Converter (ADC) located on the DSP board. The ADC sequentially samples one of the eight channels per ping group (the number of ping groups per ensemble is the maximum of the WP). These fields are zeroed at the beginning of the deployment and updated each ensemble at the rate of one channel per ping group.

error_status_word_1.description: Contains the long word containing the bit flags for the CY Command. The ESW is cleared (set to zero) between each ensemble.

error_status_word_2.description: Contains the long word containing the bit flags for the CY Command. The ESW is cleared (set to zero) between each ensemble.

error_status_word_3.description: Contains the long word containing the bit flags for the CY Command. The ESW is cleared (set to zero) between each ensemble.

error_status_word_4.description: Contains the long word containing the bit flags for the CY Command. The ESW is cleared (set to zero) between each ensemble.

pressure.description: Contains the pressure of the water at the transducer head relative to one atmosphere (sea level). Output is in deca-pascals.

pressure_variance.description: Contains the variance (deviation about the mean) of the pressure sensor data. Output is in deca-pascals.

y2k_century.description: Contains the time from the Y2K compliant real-time clock (RTC) that the current data ensemble began. The TT command (Set Real-Time Clock) initially sets the clock. The WorkHorse ADCP does account for leap years.

y2k_year.description: Contains the time from the Y2K compliant real-time clock (RTC) that the current data ensemble began. The TT command (Set Real-Time Clock) initially sets the clock. The WorkHorse ADCP does account for leap years.

y2k_month.description: Contains the time from the Y2K compliant real-time clock (RTC) that the current data ensemble began. The TT command (Set Real-Time Clock) initially sets the clock. The WorkHorse ADCP does account for leap years.

y2k_day.description: Contains the time from the Y2K compliant real-time clock (RTC) that the current data ensemble began. The TT command (Set Real-Time Clock) initially sets the clock. The WorkHorse ADCP does account for leap years.

y2k_hour.description: Contains the time from the Y2K compliant real-time clock (RTC) that the current data ensemble began. The TT command (Set Real-Time Clock) initially sets the clock. The WorkHorse ADCP does account for leap years.

y2k_minute.description: Contains the time from the Y2K compliant real-time clock (RTC) that the current data ensemble began. The TT command (Set Real-Time Clock) initially sets the clock. The WorkHorse ADCP does account for leap years.

y2k_second.description: Contains the time from the Y2K compliant real-time clock (RTC) that the current data ensemble began. The TT command (Set Real-Time Clock) initially sets the clock. The WorkHorse ADCP does account for leap years.

y2k_hundredth.description: Contains the time from the Y2K compliant real-time clock (RTC) that the current data ensemble began. The TT command (Set Real-Time Clock) initially sets the clock. The WorkHorse ADCP does account for leap years.
